{
  "gene_name_or_id": "infA",
  "locus_tag": "TX50_RS06200",
  "old_locus_tag": "PMM1151",
  "protein_id": "WP_011132784.1",
  "product": "translation initiation factor IF-1",
  "gene_function": "The infA gene encodes translation initiation factor IF-1, a key component of prokaryotic protein synthesis machinery. IF-1 binds to the A-site of the 30S ribosomal subunit during translation initiation, facilitating ribosomal subunit dissociation and enhancing the accuracy of start codon selection.",
  "research_findings": [
    {
      "finding_category": "physiological",
      "finding_sub_category": "photosynthetic protein expression",
      "finding_description": "Impaired translation initiation reduces expression of photosynthetic proteins, directly compromising light-harvesting efficiency and carbon fixation.",
      "finding_evidence": "Research on Synechocystis shows that translation factors regulate photosynthetic complex formation.",
      "finding_type": "physiological impact",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC3791720/"
      ],
      "organism": "Synechocystis",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Close",
      "additional_notes": "While not explicitly studied in Prochlorococcus, the physiological impacts are suggested based on related cyanobacteria.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "stress response",
      "finding_sub_category": "chromatic stress",
      "finding_description": "Paralogous translation initiation factors regulate photosynthetic gene expression under chromatic stress.",
      "finding_evidence": "Studies in Fremyella diplosiphon reveal potential roles for initiation factors in environmental adaptation.",
      "finding_type": "stress response",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC3791720/"
      ],
      "organism": "Fremyella diplosiphon",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Relevant",
      "additional_notes": "No direct evidence links IF-1 to stress response in Prochlorococcus.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "nutrient uptake",
      "finding_sub_category": "none",
      "finding_description": "No evidence suggests IF-1 involvement in nutrient uptake.",
      "finding_evidence": "Cyanobacterial nutrient acquisition relies on dedicated systems unrelated to ribosomal initiation factors.",
      "finding_type": "nutrient uptake",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11221513/"
      ],
      "organism": "Cyanobacteria",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "Nutrient uptake is primarily mediated by specialized transporters.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "nutrient release",
      "finding_sub_category": "none",
      "finding_description": "No studies associate IF-1 with metabolite release.",
      "finding_evidence": "Nutrient excretion in cyanobacteria typically involves passive diffusion or specialized efflux systems.",
      "finding_type": "nutrient release",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11221513/"
      ],
      "organism": "Cyanobacteria",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "Translation factors play no documented role in metabolite release.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "oxidative stress",
      "finding_sub_category": "none",
      "finding_description": "IF-1 is not directly linked to oxidative stress management.",
      "finding_evidence": "Cyanobacterial oxidative defense primarily involves catalases and peroxidases.",
      "finding_type": "oxidative stress",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11221513/"
      ],
      "organism": "Cyanobacteria",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "No explicit mechanisms are documented for IF-1 in oxidative stress.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "coculture role",
      "finding_sub_category": "none",
      "finding_description": "No studies address IF-1's role in coculture interactions.",
      "finding_evidence": "Bacterial cross-talk typically involves metabolite exchange regulated by metabolic genes.",
      "finding_type": "coculture role",
      "url": [
        "https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.0711165105"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus- Alteromonas systems",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Relevant",
      "additional_notes": "The gene's conserved function suggests it maintains proteome integrity during interactions.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    }
  ]
}

{
  "gene_name_or_id": "hemL",
  "locus_tag": "TX50_RS02605",
  "old_locus_tag": "PMM0483",
  "protein_id": "WP_011132118.1",
  "product": "glutamate-1-semialdehyde 2,1-aminomutase",
  "gene_function": "The hemL gene encodes glutamate-1-semialdehyde 2,1-aminomutase (GSAM), a key enzyme in the C5 pathway for δ-aminolevulinic acid (ALA) biosynthesis, essential for synthesizing photosynthetic pigments and electron transport components.",
  "research_findings": [
    {
      "finding_category": "physiological",
      "finding_sub_category": "chlorophyll production",
      "finding_description": "Disruption of hemL impairs chlorophyll production, directly compromising photosynthetic efficiency and growth in photoautotrophs like Prochlorococcus.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown",
      "finding_type": "gene function",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10504260/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "Heme deficiency from impaired hemL function affects respiratory electron transport chains and redox homeostasis.",
      "confidence_score": 5
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "stress response",
      "finding_sub_category": "light stress",
      "finding_description": "While no direct studies link hemL to stress responses in Prochlorococcus, its role in tetrapyrrole biosynthesis implies indirect involvement in stress adaptation through heme/chlorophyll homeostasis.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown",
      "finding_type": "stress response",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11221513/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "Chlorophyll depletion could exacerbate light stress.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "nutrient uptake",
      "finding_sub_category": "iron acquisition",
      "finding_description": "Heme-derived compounds in cyanobacteria require iron, implying that hemL-dependent heme biosynthesis could indirectly affect iron acquisition systems.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown",
      "finding_type": "nutrient uptake",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11221513/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "No direct evidence links hemL to nutrient uptake mechanisms.",
      "confidence_score": 2
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "bacterial interaction",
      "finding_sub_category": "coculture role",
      "finding_description": "hemL-dependent chlorophyll production influences photosynthate release, which sustains heterotrophic partners like Alteromonas.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown",
      "finding_type": "coculture role",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10504260/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "Nitrogen limitation could amplify this interaction if hemL expression affects nitrogen allocation to chlorophyll.",
      "confidence_score": 2
    }
  ]
}

        "https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/1590707/"
      ],

      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "The gene itself isn't implicated in regulatory pathways for nutrient secretion.",

    {
      "finding_category": "oxidative stress",
      "finding_sub_category": "ROS production",
      "finding_description": "Impaired complex assembly could exacerbate ROS production by disrupting electron flow.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown",

      "url": [
        "https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/1590707/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",

      "additional_notes": "No direct evidence of its regulatory role in oxidative stress mitigation was found.",
      "confidence_score": 3
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "coculture role",
      "finding_sub_category": "indirect influence",
      "finding_description": "In nitrogen-limited Prochlorococcus-Alteromonas systems, petD activity might indirectly influence interactions by modulating photosynthate production.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown",

      "url": [
        "https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/1590707/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",

    }
  ]
}

{
  "gene_name_or_id": "pheA",

      ],
      "organism": "E. coli, Corynebacterium glutamicum",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "Disruption of this pathway could impair growth due to phenylalanine auxotrophy.",
      "confidence_score": 5
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "stress response",
      "finding_sub_category": "nutrient stress",
      "finding_description": "Amino acid biosynthesis genes, including pheA, may exhibit altered expression under nitrogen limitation, potentially upregulating aromatic amino acid synthesis.",

      "url": [],
      "organism": "E. coli",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "Feedback inhibition-resistant pheA mutants enhance phenylalanine production under metabolic stress.",
      "confidence_score": 5
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "nutrient exudation",
      "finding_sub_category": "phenylalanine release",
      "finding_description": "PheA influences nutrient release through phenylalanine production, with potential benefits for auxotrophic partners in cocultures.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown",

        "https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.0711165105",
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7133116/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "Prochlorococcus releases up to 50% of fixed carbon as organic compounds, including amino acids.",
      "confidence_score": 5
    }
  ]
}

{
  "gene_name_or_id": "fba",
  "locus_tag": "TX50_RS04170",
  "old_locus_tag": "PMM0781",
  "protein_id": "WP_011132415.1",
  "product": "fructose-bisphosphate aldolase class II",
  "gene_function": "Fructose-bisphosphate aldolase (FBA) is a key enzyme in central carbon metabolism, catalyzing the reversible cleavage of fructose-1,6-bisphosphate to glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate and dihydroxyacetone phosphate.",
  "research_findings": [
    {
      "finding_category": "gene function",
      "finding_sub_category": "horizontal gene transfer",
      "finding_description": "Genomic evidence reveals that some Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus strains have acquired a eukaryotic class I FBA gene via horizontal transfer, which in certain strains has completely replaced the ancestral class II FBA gene.",
      "finding_evidence": "genomic evidence from Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus",
      "finding_type": "gene function",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC1919352/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "This substitution indicates functional equivalence in glycolysis and the Calvin cycle.",
      "confidence_score": 6
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "physiological",
      "finding_sub_category": "carbon fixation",
      "finding_description": "Strains lacking the ancestral class II gene rely solely on the class I enzyme for carbon fixation and energy production, confirming its functional sufficiency in core metabolic pathways.",
      "finding_evidence": "direct genomic evidence",
      "finding_type": "physiological",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC1919352/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "This gene replacement suggests no detrimental physiological effects, indicating robust adaptation.",
      "confidence_score": 6
    }
  ]
}

{
  "gene_name_or_id": "lpxA",
  "locus_tag": "TX50_RS07165",
  "old_locus_tag": "PMM1335",
  "protein_id": "WP_036930507.1",
  "product": "acyl-ACP--UDP-N-acetylglucosamine O-acyltransferase",
  "gene_function": "The lpxA gene encodes an acyl-ACP–UDP-N-acetylglucosamine O-acyltransferase, which catalyzes the first committed step of lipid A biosynthesis in Gram-negative bacteria.",
  "research_findings": [
    {
      "finding_category": "physiological",
      "finding_sub_category": "outer membrane integrity",
      "finding_description": "LpxA is essential for outer membrane integrity in Gram-negative bacteria. Mutations in lpxA alter lipid A structure, leading to compromised membrane permeability and cell viability.",
      "finding_evidence": "Mutant phenotype analysis in Acinetobacter and hybrid lipid A structures generated by heterologous lpxA expression.",
      "finding_type": "physiological impact",
      "url": [
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC2569861/",
        "https://card.mcmaster.ca/ontology/40183"
      ],
      "organism": "Acinetobacter",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "Specific lpxA mutations confer resistance to colistin by reducing the negative charge of the outer membrane.",
      "confidence_score": 6
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "stress response",
      "finding_sub_category": "antimicrobial resistance",
      "finding_description": "LpxA-mediated lipid A biosynthesis is critical for stress adaptation. Mutations in lpxA confer resistance to antimicrobial peptides by altering lipid A structure.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown.",
      "finding_type": "stress response",
      "url": [
        "https://card.mcmaster.ca/ontology/40183"
      ],
      "organism": "Gram-negative pathogens",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "This represents a key antibiotic resistance mechanism in Gram-negative pathogens.",
      "confidence_score": 6
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "nutrient uptake",
      "finding_sub_category": "membrane permeability",
      "finding_description": "The outer membrane integrity maintained by LpxA-dependent LPS synthesis indirectly influences nutrient uptake by regulating porin function and membrane permeability.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown.",
      "finding_type": "nutrient uptake",
      "url": [],
      "organism": "Gram-negative bacteria",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "Compromised LPS due to lpxA mutations could affect diffusion of small molecules across the outer membrane.",
      "confidence_score": 6
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "bacterial interaction",
      "finding_sub_category": "LPS-dependent mechanisms",
      "finding_description": "LpxA influences bacterial interactions through LPS-dependent mechanisms, affecting host immune recognition.",
      "finding_evidence": "Experimental method is unknown.",
      "finding_type": "coculture role",
      "url": [],
      "organism": "Gram-negative pathogens",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Distant",
      "additional_notes": "The essential nature of LPS in Gram-negative bacteria suggests potential indirect effects on cross-species interactions.",
      "confidence_score": 6
    }
  ]
}

{
  "gene_name_or_id": "kaiC",
  "locus_tag": "TX50_RS07200",
  "old_locus_tag": "PMM1342",
  "protein_id": "WP_011132976.1",
  "product": "circadian clock protein KaiC",
  "gene_function": "KaiC is a core circadian clock protein in cyanobacteria that forms a central component of the KaiABC oscillator, functioning as a homohexameric complex with ATPase activity.",
  "research_findings": [
    {
      "finding_category": "physiological",
      "finding_sub_category": "circadian rhythms",
      "finding_description": "KaiC coordinates genome-wide physiological rhythms, including metabolic and photosynthetic processes, maintaining circadian oscillations even during metabolic shutdown.",
      "finding_evidence": "gene expression analysis in Synechococcus",
      "finding_type": "physiological impact",
      "url": [
        "https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.0307411100",
        "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC313937/"
      ],
      "organism": "Prochlorococcus",
      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "Suggests function is prioritized under energy-limited conditions.",
      "confidence_score": 6
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "stress response",
      "finding_sub_category": "indirect stress adaptation",
      "finding_description": "KaiC's role in maintaining circadian rhythms under metabolic repression implies indirect stress adaptation, helping anticipate periodic stressors.",
      "finding_evidence": "observational studies in Synechococcus",

      ],

      "phylogenetic_distance": "Direct",
      "additional_notes": "MinD's C-terminal amphipathic helix mediates membrane binding, a mechanism conserved in gram-negative bacteria.",
      "confidence_score": 7
    },
    {
      "finding_category": "gene function",
      "finding_sub_category": "division site regulation",
      "finding_description": "MinD exhibits pole-to-pole oscillation and requires preferential binding to the plasma membrane over thylakoids for proper division site positioning.",
